text:
Is it possible to exclude tags from the related_blog_posts tag. This is the way to select the included tag:
```{% related_blog_posts blog_post_ids="3267910554", limit=10, tags="sales enablement" %}```
Is there a way to exclude one or different specific tags? Thank you so much!
when inside of a HubL expresion e.g. `{% blah %}` why is it that sometimes you have to use double brackets for a HubL variable and other times you have to exclude them? :face_with_raised_eyebrow:

Weird hubL bug: When I write the following code I get this error:
```{% module "card_3"
      path="/opus/modules/pricing_card",
      no_wrapper=true,
      card_name="Enterprise",
      price="Tiered Pricing",
      description="For organizations and multiple teams",
      categories=[
        {
          "category_name":"Scaling Metrics",
          "features": []
        }
      ]
    %}```
If I remove the whitespace around `"features"` it works though

```{% module "card_3"
      path="/opus/modules/pricing_card",
      no_wrapper=true,
      card_name="Enterprise",
      price="Tiered Pricing",
      description="For organizations and multiple teams",
      categories=[
        {
          "category_name":"Scaling Metrics",
          "features": []}
      ]
    %}```
:point_up: this works
Strange, I will throw up an issue to look into this

what is the variable for disabling in content editor on a module ?
`{% module 'contextual_navigation' path='@HubSpot/simple_menu %}`
